meanings.definition: Having the least luck or fortune.
meanings.sent1: She felt like the unluckiest person in the world when she lost her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: He always seemed to be the unluckiest player on the team, never winning any games.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he remained the unluckiest when it came to finding four-leaf clovers.
meanings.sent4: In the game of life, she was dealt the unluckiest hand, facing one challenge after another.
meanings.sent5: The unluckiest black cat in town seemed to bring misfortune wherever it went.

meanings.sent1: After losing her job, getting sick, and breaking her phone all in one day, she felt like the unluckiest person alive.
meanings.sent2: He was always the unluckiest one in the group, getting caught in the rain without an umbrella.
meanings.sent3: The unluckiest squirrel in the park kept dropping its acorns in the pond by accident.
meanings.sent4: She was the unluckiest star in the sky, constantly being overshadowed by brighter ones.
meanings.sent5: The unluckiest penny in the fountain never brought any wishes to those who tossed it in.
